cab.content: (1). V/iil3T^KW PROMT .Last night, Australian troops curried out a minor operation in the neighbourhood or MDRRIS and advanced their line to a depth of 250 yards on a front of 1,200 yards. 16 prisoners and 1 machine j*un wore captured. Tho enemy delivered 2 counter-attacks on our new front N.E. of VILLtiiRS BRIiTOWNIHirX, one between 10 and 11 p.m. last night, end the other between 2,30 and 3 this morning. Both were repulsed. Hostile artillery fire has shown considerable increase in this sector.On the French front, the situation remains unchanged. (2), ITALIAN FROIJT.There is nothing of interest to report.& * -a x *;ieral Staff,far Office, S..,,.l, ih July, 1918. med at 12,40 p.m.
